newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Blast reported in central Kabul.
newsitem.headline: Blast reported in central Kabul.

text.p: A big explosion rocked the centre of the Afghan capital Kabul on Sunday afternoon, causing several casualties, a Pakistan-based Afghan news service said.
The Afghan Islamic Press (AIP) said there were about 15 casualties, including an unknown number of fatalities, in the blast at a bus stop in the Serai Shehzada market area.
There was no immediate information about the cause of the blast, which shattered window of nearby buildings and was widely heard in the war-shattered city, AIP said, quoting its sources in Kabul.
It followed an air-raid on northeast Kabul by a lone plane earlier in the day, which local hospitals said killed at least four people and wounded 15, including a United Nations employee.
